item.title: ‘Avoid panic’: Amid HMPV scare, Pune district collector calls for taking precautionary measures - The Indian Express
item.description:
Pune District Collector Addresses HMPV Concerns, Urges Calm and Precautions

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Pune District Collector Jitendra Dudi has reassured citizens regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that it is not a new threat and advising against panic. He emphasized the importance of basic health precautions.

  • The district saw around 20 HMPV cases in the pediatric group and 4-5 cases in adults.
  • No unusual surge in respiratory illnesses associated with HMPV has been reported in the country.
  • Dr. Aarti Kinikar noted that the last HMPV case in Pune was detected on November 28 of last year.
  • The state has increased surveillance due to an outbreak in China.
  • A total of 48,019 individuals with suspected symptoms were screened in Maharashtra recently.
“This is not a new virus and we have urged people not to panic.” - Jitendra Dudi

Health officials stress the need for calm as the situation develops; monitoring will continue to ensure public safety.

item.title: IIP growth rises to a six-month high of 5.2% in November - Moneycontrol
item.description:
IIP Growth Reaches 5.2% in November, the Highest in Six Months

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Moneycontrol

The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) in India has grown by 5.2% in November, marking the highest growth rate in the last six months.

  • The core sector output expanded to a four-month high of 4.3% in November.
  • This growth is compared to the previous month's growth rate of 3.7%.
  • Continued growth indicates positive trends in industrial activity across various sectors.
“This growth signifies a recovery in industrial production post-pandemic.”

This increase in IIP reflects the resilience of the industrial sector and its importance for the overall economy.

item.title: IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights, 1st ODI: India take 1-0 lead in series with six-wicket victory over hosts - The Financial Express
item.description:
India Women Secure Six-Wicket Victory Over Ireland in 1st ODI

Date: 10 Jan 2025
Source: Financial Express

India Women started their tour of Ireland successfully by winning the first ODI with a six-wicket margin, chasing down Ireland’s total comfortably.

  • India Women chased down Ireland's target of 239 runs, ending at 240/4 in 34.3 overs.
  • Ireland posted 238/7 in their 50 overs, with notable contributions from Gaby Lewis (92) and Leah Paul (59).
  • Pratika Rawal top-scored for India with 89 runs, supported by Smriti Mandhana’s quick 41 and Tejal Hasabnis with an unbeaten 53.
  • Indian bowlers performed well, with Priya Mishra taking 2 wickets for 56 runs and Aimee Maguire claiming 3 for 57 for Ireland.
  • The win gave India a 1-0 lead in the series, setting up excitement for the next matches.
"India's efficient batting performance and disciplined bowling efforts were key to their victory."

Looking ahead, India aims to maintain their winning momentum in the upcoming ODI matches against Ireland.

item.title: Underworld Don Chhota Rajan Admitted To AIIMS-Delhi For Sinus Treatment, Might Need Surgery - News18
item.description:
Chhota Rajan Hospitalized for Sinus Treatment at AIIMS-Delhi

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: News18

Underworld don Chhota Rajan has been admitted to AIIMS Delhi for sinus treatment, with doctors suggesting that he might need surgery.

  • Chhota Rajan, also known as Rajendra Sadashiv Nikalje, is in Tihar Jail.
  • He was arrested by Indonesian police in October 2015 and extradited to India.
  • In May 2024, he was sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of hotelier Jaya Shetty.
  • Rajan has been found guilty in seven cases, including six in Mumbai.
“Doctors hinted that Chhota Rajan might need an operation owing to which he has been admitted.”

This hospitalization could indicate serious health issues for Chhota Rajan, raising questions about his medical care while incarcerated.

item.title: 'Damage control': Congress mock PM Modi 'not a God' remark in his first podcast appearance - The Times of India
item.description:
'Damage control': Congress mock PM Modi 'not a God' remark in his first podcast appearance

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

NEW DELHI: The Congress on Friday mocked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his comments during his first podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath.

  • Congress leader Jairam Ramesh stated that Modi's remarks were an attempt at damage control after he had claimed he was sent by God.
  • During the podcast, Modi mentioned his previous role as Gujarat's chief minister and acknowledged that he is human and can make mistakes.
  • This podcast marks Modi's debut in the podcasting platform, despite his regular presence in other media.
“I said something in an insensitive way. Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God,” said PM Modi.

The discussion emphasizes the need for public service-driven individuals in politics, focusing on mission rather than personal ambition.

item.title: More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura - Moneycontrol
item.description:
More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

According to the report, RBI has been intervening "heavily" in the FX over the past two months, causing a drain on the INR liquidity.

  • Nomura emphasizes the need for more Variable Rate Reverse repos (VRRs), swaps, and Open Market Operations (OMOs) by the RBI.
  • There are indications that further Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) cuts might be necessary.
  • The intervention by RBI in the foreign exchange market has significantly impacted liquidity in the Indian rupee.
“Further CRR cuts cannot be ruled out and that alternative measures look more likely now.”

This analysis underscores the need for the RBI to adopt additional measures to stabilize the rupee liquidity and prevent negative economic impacts.

item.title: Varun Aaron announces retirement from representative cricket - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Varun Aaron Announces Retirement from Representative Cricket

Published on: Fri, Jan 10, 2025, 10:01 AM
Source: Cricbuzz

Fast bowler Varun Aaron has retired from all representative cricket following Jharkhand's exit from the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. After giving up red-ball cricket, he now relinquishes white-ball formats as well.

  • Varun Aaron, 35, has announced his retirement after a career spanning over two decades.
  • He took three wickets at an average of 53.33 in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Aaron mentioned his gratitude and love for fast bowling in his retirement announcement on Instagram.
  • He made his debut in ODI and Test cricket after a remarkable performance in the 2010-11 Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Aaron played 18 international matches, taking 29 wickets for India.
  • In first-class cricket, he took 173 wickets and appeared in nine IPL seasons, winning a title in 2022.
“Fast bowling has been my first love, and though I step off the field, it will always be a part of who I am.” - Varun Aaron

Aaron's departure marks the end of a significant chapter in his cricketing journey, but he looks forward to enjoying life beyond the field.

item.title: Govt lab confirms HMPV infection in 8-yr-old; cases in Gujarat rise to 3 - Business Standard
item.description:
Govt lab confirms HMPV infection in 8-yr-old; cases in Gujarat rise to 3

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Business Standard

An eight-year-old boy from Gujarat's Sabarkantha district has been confirmed to have contracted human metapneumovirus (HMPV), raising the total number of cases in the state to three. He is currently being treated in a hospital but is stable.

  • The boy is from a family of farm laborers in Prantij taluka.
  • A private lab first detected HMPV, later confirmed by a government lab.
  • The boy is on a ventilator but his condition is stable.
  • A two-month-old boy from Rajasthan was the first reported case in Gujarat.
  • An 80-year-old man with HMPV is receiving treatment in Ahmedabad.
“He is currently under treatment and his condition is stable,” said Sabarkantha District Collector Ratankanvar Gadhavicharan.

HMPV spreads through respiratory droplets and contaminated surfaces, similar to the Respiratory Syncytial Virus.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25, S25+, S25 Ultra price leaked, phones could cost more this time - India Today
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25, S25+, S25 Ultra price leaked, phones could cost more this time

Published on: Jan 10, 2025 by: Nandini Yadav

Samsung is scheduled to host the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, showcasing the new Galaxy S25 series, with leaked pricing information surfacing ahead of the official announcement.

Key Points:

  • The Galaxy S25 series will include the S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra, with rumors of an S25 Slim variant.
  • Pricing for the Galaxy S25 starts at 964 euros (~Rs 85,000) for the 128GB model, with higher capacities costing more.
  • The Galaxy S25+ is expected to start at 1,235 euros (~Rs 1,09,000), while the S25 Ultra could start at 1,557 euros (~Rs 1,38,000).
  • Colour options include icy blue, mint, navy, silver, and more premium shades for the Ultra variant.
  • Pre-reservations in India have begun, allowing customers to customize their orders and receive exclusive offers.

Notable Quotes:

“Pre-reservations in India have started for Rs 1,999, offering early access and benefits worth Rs 5,000.”

As the release date approaches, consumers are eager to see how the new models will compete in the high-end smartphone market.

item.title: "I'm Only Human, Not God": PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath - NDTV
item.description:
I'm Only Human, Not God: PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: News Article

In his debut podcast appearance on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's show, Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged his flaws, stating, 'I too can make mistakes.' He comforted Kamath over his Hindi skills, emphasizing their shared understanding.

  • Prime Minister Modi discusses his humanity and the inevitability of mistakes.
  • Nikhil Kamath expresses concerns about his language skills due to his South Indian background.
  • The podcast covers Modi’s childhood, education, and challenges faced in politics.
  • PM Modi actively engages with Kamath, making the dialogue personal and relatable.
  • Modi shared a light-hearted anecdote about his childhood chores.
'Mistakes happen, and I too can make some. I am also a human, not god.' - PM Modi

Modi shared a heartfelt message with listeners, hoping they enjoyed the podcast as much as he did creating it.

item.title: 300 million-year-old hotspot linked to the formation of the Great Lakes discovered by scientists; where i - The Times of India
item.description:
300 million-year-old hotspot linked to the formation of the Great Lakes discovered by scientists; where is it now?

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

The discovery of a hotspot beneath the ancient supercontinent Pangaea is a significant advancement in understanding the geological history of the Great Lakes region.

  • The Cape Verde hotspot has been linked to the formation of the Great Lakes over 300 million years ago.
  • The discovery reveals how tectonic activities and glacial movements contributed to shaping the landscape.
  • Seismic anomalies indicate past deformation of the lithosphere beneath the Great Lakes region influenced by the hotspot.
“The connection between the Cape Verde hotspot and the Great Lakes adds a new layer of understanding to geological processes.”

This groundbreaking research helps to understand not just the formation of the Great Lakes, but also the broader trends in geological developments influenced by ancient hotspots.

item.title: HMPV in India: 8-year-old infected with virus; cases in Gujarat rise to 3 - The Economic Times
item.description:
HMPV in India: 8-Year-Old Infected as Cases Rise to 3 in Gujarat

Publication Date: January 6, 2023
Source: Local News

An eight-year-old child from Sabarkantha has tested positive for human metapneumovirus (HMPV), bringing the total number of reported cases in Gujarat to three.

  • First case recorded on January 6, 2023, involving a two-month-old boy from Rajasthan.
  • HMPV belongs to the Paramyxoviridae family and is similar to the Respiratory Syncytial Virus.
  • Transmission occurs through respiratory droplets, contaminated surfaces, or direct contact.
“HMPV is closely related to the Respiratory Syncytial Virus and spreads primarily through respiratory droplets.”

This recent infection raises concerns about the spread of HMPV in the region, highlighting the importance of preventive measures.

item.title: Mutual fund SIP inflow at record high, but why is Nifty down 10% from peak? - The Economic Times
item.description:
Mutual fund SIP inflow at record high, but why is Nifty down 10% from peak?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

This article discusses the contrast between record SIP inflows in mutual funds and the Nifty 50's performance, which remains 10% below its peak due to foreign outflows and market uncertainties.

  • Record SIP contributions reached Rs 26,459 crore in December 2024.
  • Despite robust inflows, the Nifty 50 has struggled with headwinds from foreign institutional investor selling.
  • Market expert Sandip Sabharwal notes that domestic investors continue to use SIPs as a long-term investment strategy.
  • Concerns about high valuations and a weakening rupee add to the market's struggles.
“The equity cult in India is now well-established… and regular SIP flows are likely to continue.” - Sandip Sabharwal

In conclusion, while domestic investors show optimism through SIPs, the broader market faces significant challenges which may affect long-term sentiment.

item.title: Hrithik Roshan turns 51: Sussanne Khan says his best is yet to come, Ameesha Patel wishes him ‘Gadar of a year’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hrithik Roshan Turns 51: Sussanne Khan Says His Best Is Yet to Come, Ameesha Patel Wishes Him ‘Gadar of a Year’

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

As Hrithik Roshan celebrates his 51st birthday today, his debut film Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai has been re-released in cinemas to mark the occasion. Celebrities from across the industry took to social media to share their wishes.

  • Sussanne Khan celebrated by sharing a group picture and expressed her belief that Hrithik's best is yet to come.
  • Ameesha Patel wished Hrithik a double celebration for his birthday and the 25th anniversary of their film Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai.
  • Rakesh Roshan, Hrithik's father, shared childhood pictures and expressed his love.
  • Anil Kapoor reminisced about Hrithik's journey from intern to star, celebrating 25 years of his stardom.
  • Hrithik will next be seen in a docuseries about his family's history and in War 2.
“Keep shining!” - Anil Kapoor

As Hrithik reaches this milestone, fans and friends alike are excited for what lies ahead in his career.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 and Oppo Reno 13 Pro launched: Price in India, specs, and all you need to know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 and Oppo Reno 13 Pro launched: Price in India, specs, and all you need to know

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Oppo has unveiled the Oppo Reno 13 series, featuring the Oppo Reno 13 and Oppo Reno 13 Pro 5G, positioned as upper mid-range devices.

Key Points:

  • Oppo Reno 13 priced at ₹37,999 for 8GB RAM/128GB storage; 8GB RAM/256GB for ₹39,999.
  • Oppo Reno 13 Pro priced at ₹49,999 for 12GB RAM/256GB storage; 12GB RAM/512GB for ₹54,999.
  • Available in Luminous Blue and Ivory White (Reno 13) and Mist Lavender and Graphite Grey (Reno 13 Pro).
  • Ships starting January 11 via Oppo's website and Flipkart.
  • Both models feature MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset with varying RAM and storage options.
  • Display: Reno 13 Pro has a 6.83-inch AMOLED, Reno 13 has a 6.59-inch display, both with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Camera: Reno 13 Pro has a triple setup (50MP main, 50MP telephoto, 8MP ultrawide); Reno 13 has a 50MP main, 8MP ultrawide, and 2MP monochrome.
  • Battery: Reno 13 Pro has a 5800mAh battery with 80W fast charging; Reno 13 has a 5600mAh battery with similar charging.

Notable Quotes:

“Both phones offer instant bank discounts of 10%.”

Conclusion:

The launch of the Oppo Reno 13 series enhances Oppo's mid-range offerings, with competitive pricing and specifications appealing to a wide audience.

item.title: HMPV in China: Government in contact with WHO on respiratory diseases, says foreign ministry - The Hindu
item.description:
China Maintains Communication with WHO on HMPV Cases

Date: January 10, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Chinese foreign ministry confirmed ongoing communication with the WHO regarding respiratory diseases, particularly concerning the human metapneumovirus (HMPV) affecting China.

  • The Chinese foreign ministry stated that they prioritize the health of both citizens and foreigners.
  • HMPV has been circulating in humans for over 60 years.
  • China's CDC reported sustained high levels of HMPV cases in the latest update.
“The HMPV is not a new virus and has been circulating in humans for more than 60 years.” - Guo Jiakun, Foreign ministry spokesperson

The Chinese government's proactive communication may help alleviate public concerns about HMPV cases and emphasize the ongoing surveillance of respiratory diseases.

item.title: What to drink for weight loss? Nutritionist shares 5 detox beverages to reduce fat - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What to drink for weight loss? Nutritionist shares 5 detox beverages to reduce fat

Jan 10, 2025 02:20 PM IST - Hindustan Times

Hydration is crucial when trying to lose weight. The article emphasizes the importance of detox drinks, which provide natural goodness while being low in calories.

Key Points:

  • Importance of hydration in weight loss.
  • Detox water is low in calories and energizing.
  • 5 detox drinks recommended: Methi water, Fennel water, Cinnamon orange infusion, CFC tea (Coriander, fennel, and cumin), Tulsi and ginger root boost.
  • Benefits of detox water include detoxifying the body, adding electrolytes, vitamins, and minerals.
  • Experts highlight benefits such as improving metabolism and digestion.
“Detox water has a lot of benefits minus calories. These fruits add electrolytes, vitamins, and minerals [to water] and keep your body hydrated.” - Nutritionist Kavita Devgan

This article provides insights into how detox beverages can support weight loss and overall wellness.

item.title: OnePlus 13 goes on sale in India today: First sale offers, price, specs and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
OnePlus 13 goes on sale in India today: First sale offers, price, specs and more

Date: January 10, 2023

Source: Live Mint

The OnePlus 13 has officially launched in India, featuring several promotional offers including significant bank discounts and exchange bonuses.

Key Specifications:

  • 6.82-inch 120Hz ProXDR LPTO 4.1 AMOLED display with peak brightness of 4,500 nits.
  • Powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite processor with up to 24GB of RAM and 1TB storage.
  • 6,000mAh battery supporting 100W wired and 50W wireless charging.
  • Triple 50MP camera setup with Hasselblad branding; 32MP front camera.
  • Runs on OxygenOS 15 based on Android 15 with long-term update promises.
  • Available in Midnight Ocean, Black Eclipse, and Arctic Dawn colors.
“OnePlus is offering ₹5,000 instant discount for ICICI Bank credit card users, making the effective price for the models ₹64,999, ₹71,999, and ₹84,999.”

The new flagship model starts at ₹69,999 for the 12GB RAM/256GB storage variant and will be available across various platforms including OnePlus's website and Amazon.

item.title: Physicists spot 44 stars no one knew existed thanks to ‘cosmic hall of mirrors’ effect - The Indian Express
item.description:
Physicists spot 44 stars no one knew existed, thanks to ‘cosmic hall of mirrors’ effect

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

A group of physicists at Durham University in the UK has identified over 44 previously unknown stars located in the Dragon Arc galaxy, nearly 6.5 billion light-years away.

  • The stars were hidden behind the Abell 370 cluster of galaxies.
  • Identified using images from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).
  • Discovered stars observed during “cosmic noon,” a peak star birth era.
  • Gravitational lensing allowed for magnification of distant light.
  • First significant observation of stars at such a distance.
“This very particular type of star we have detected in the Dragon Arc, called red supergiants, are very difficult to observe...” - Dr. Mathilde Jauzac

This discovery could enhance understanding of star formation and the universe's evolution.
